description.narrative: This project mainly contributes to results within Combating gender based violence. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020

Women for Change project under the Center for Girls (CFG) is Chiang Kong wide initiative to build core women to extend their leadership in community through workshop and training. The target rights holders are women in Chiang Kong who are unequal members of community leadership to represent women concerns particular within ethnic communities where traditional and attitude are against women’s rights. The project aims to build 204 core women and secondary target group of 6,014 people within 5 years The project goal is women in Chiang Khong are equal members of their communities, having the opportunity to pursue their goals and aspirations personally and collectively, free from all forms of GBV The project objectives are women empowered in gender equality and women’s rights.  Enhance confidence in women to make positive changes in their own lives and their communities, and equip them with leadership skills. The initiative will also use this same platform to address the high rates of gender based violence (GBV) in the district The project expects that in five-year project will be the creation of Women for Change Network. Core women in leadership program will serve as a resource for women to seek information and advice, and report instances of GBV, long after the project has finished The combined effect of these activities including campaigns, data collection, and workshops in the community will be used and increased awareness of GBV, strengthened local law, and people at all levels. Set up/strengthen a GBV victim emergency support group. In collaboration with the local leadership project will be advocating for the development and implementation of a local anti-GBV law Project thematic areas are Rights of children and women, Anti-human trafficking, Prevention of sexual abuse of children, Sexual education for young people  Other stakeholders include local authorities, NGO’s and private sector and women networks.
